summary:
The Internet is a massive network of computers around the world. It connects different types of networks, allowing devices to communicate using specific rules called TCP/IP. The Internet started with research in the 1960s and grew from academic and military use to a global phenomenon. It carries lots of information, like websites, emails, and videos.

Over time, the Internet changed how we communicate, access news, shop, and connect with others. It has made traditional media like newspapers and phone calls less important. Many businesses and services now operate online, showing the Internet's huge impact on our daily lives.
title: Internet
